title: Lantern Fly Photo Collection Guide
purpose: Training data for binary classification model

overview.goal: Collect 500 high-quality photos of dead/squashed lantern flies
overview.use_case: Training a machine learning model to identify lantern flies
overview.classification: Binary: Lantern Fly vs Non-Lantern Fly

quality.format: JPG, PNG, or other common image formats
quality.focus: Sharp focus on the insect, avoid blurry images
quality.lighting: Good lighting, avoid shadows or overexposure
quality.composition: Insect should fill at least 30% of the frame

content.subject: Dead or squashed spotted lantern flies (Lycorma delicatula)
content.condition: Various states of damage (freshly dead to heavily squashed)
content.angle: Multiple angles (top view, side view, close-up)
content.size: Include both adult and nymph lantern flies if possible

avoid: Images where the insect is too small
Images with multiple insects (focus on single insects)

best_times: After rain (when insects are more visible)
weather_conditions: Avoid heavy rain or strong winds

systematic_approach.grid_search: Divide campus into sections and search systematically
systematic_approach.high_traffic_areas: Focus on areas with high foot traffic
systematic_approach.variety: Ensure diversity in locations and conditions
systematic_approach.documentation: Note location and conditions for each photo

camera_settings.mode: Auto mode is fine, but manual focus if possible
camera_settings.flash: Use natural lighting when possible, flash if needed
camera_settings.stability: Hold camera steady, use two hands if needed

composition.framing: Fill frame with insect, leave some background context
composition.distance: Close enough to see details, far enough for context

review_later: Delete blurry or poor quality images

batch_review: Remove duplicate or very similar images
Ensure variety in conditions and locations
Verify all images show lantern flies

general: Be aware of traffic when photographing on roads
Watch for uneven surfaces and obstacles
Work in pairs if possible for safety

quality_metrics: Diversity: Photos from at least 10 different locations

common_issues.blurry_images: Hold camera steady, use two hands, check focus
common_issues.poor_lighting: Move to better lighting, use flash if needed
common_issues.small_insects: Get closer, use zoom if available
common_issues.similar_photos: Vary angles and distances, include different backgrounds

quality_improvement.focus: Tap to focus on the insect, wait for focus confirmation
quality_improvement.lighting: Position yourself to avoid shadows, use natural light
quality_improvement.composition: Fill frame with insect, leave some background context
quality_improvement.stability: Brace against objects, use two hands, take multiple shots

immediate_steps: Review and delete poor quality images
Organize photos by location or date
preparation_for_training: Verify diversity in locations and conditions
